div1.p: L. de R. du Verge to the State Depart.
Encloses. Request and causes for the same.
United States Consulate St Paul de Loanda October 15th 1882.
Hon J.C. Bancroft Davis Asst Sectry of State Washington D.C.

Sir In consideration of the unhealthy state of this locality at times, I would most respectfully solicit the Depart. of State, for a standing permissions to leave this consulate in charge of the Vice, or actg. vice consul, whenever circumstances and urgency in case of sickness may compel me to leave Loanda for a few weeks further North or South as may be directed by the Doctors.

This request may appear to you, from one who has but just joined his post, of duty, to be a departure from the general principles of the Depart. but I trust that the special nature of my humble request may induce you and the Hon: Sectry of State to take the matter with favorable consideration.

Having consular agencies futhe North and South I may be able if such is granted to me, to see personally
how the agencies are, and instruct them in their duties toward the U.S. govt, commerce, shipping &c. &c.
I have been sick for over a month with Bilious or green fever and have tried to perform the duties I have been intrusted with the best of my ability
I have the honor to be Sir your obedient servant L de R. du Verge U.S. Consul.
